question: How much precipitation a year jungles get?
Which of the following is not a jungle layer?
Which of the following facts is true?
optionOne: Only 2% of the rainwater is reaching the forest floor.
optionTwo: Only 2% of the wind is reaching the forest floor.
optionThree: Only 2% of the light is reaching the rainforest floor.
correctAnswer: Only 2% of the light is reaching the rainforest floor.

question: Which of the following statements is false?
optionOne: The jungle is so vast that it does not encourage specialization.
optionTwo: It can take up to 10 minutes for a drop of rain water to fall on the floor of the rainforest.
optionThree: The emergent layer is the dryest.
correctAnswer: The jungle is so vast that it does not encourage specialization.

question: Which of the following is false?
optionOne: Sometimes it froze in the jungle.
optionTwo: The temperature rarely exceed 35 celsius degrees in the jungle.
optionThree: Jungles are one of the most important habitat on Earth.
correctAnswer: Sometimes it froze in the jungle.

question: Which of the following is true?
optionTwo: The forest floor in the rainforest is the brigthest.
optionThree: The average humidity in the rainforest is very high and around 80%.
correctAnswer: The average humidity in the rainforest is very high and around 80%.
